SENT.plain: A 17-year-old Caucasian female patient, who had been prescribed minocycline for acne vulgaris, presented with postural visual obscurations
Ophthalmoscopic examination revealed papilloedema in each eye
Neuro-imaging of the brain and orbits was normal
A diagnosis of minocycline induced benign intracranial hypertension was made
Withdrawal of minocycline led to resolution of her symptoms and the papilloedema
